text: [Music]

OK. How do I increase my understanding 
of AI beyond off-the-shelf packages?

I've got the answer to that one: you have to 
build things. I mean many of the most capable

AI practitioners just put effort into building 
things for themselves, reimplementing things.

You know, one great example of that 
is the Stanford PhD grad Andrej Karpathy.

So Andrej has had a career, first working 
at Tesla and now he's back at OpenAI,

but you know he's also just a weekend 
hacker who likes to build things.

And the reality is that just by building 
things for yourself from scratch,

even if they replicate something that someone 
has done or a big framework from a tech company,

you just learn so much and that's 
always a great exercise to work through.

OK, what are some promising 
new career paths within AI?

So there are a lot, right. We're still at a stage 
in which there's just a huge shortage of

machine learning engineers and a huge shortage of people 
with a good understanding of neural networks,

natural language processing and 
robotics and related technologies.

So if you get good skills in these areas 
there are all sorts of things that you can do.

Every kind of industry, whether you're thinking 
the car industry, people in banking and finance,

people in construction, people who would like to 
automate mining or agriculture, anywhere you

look there are ways that you could use artificial 
intelligence to reinvent different Industries.

OK, I've completed the basics of machine learning 
and deep learning, what should I learn next?

I don't think that's a question 
that has a one-size-fits-all answer.

One answer is find a project that's something that 
you're really interested in. It could be something  at work

or it could just be something that's completely 
an interest of yours as a hobbyist thing.

So spending more time actually building an 
AI application from beginning to end is still a

huge further learning exercise after doing one 
or two of our classes. But there are lots of

other great classes you could do and I think 
at that point it depends more on what you're interested in.
[Music]
